title: Tarski's axiomatization of the reals
summary: In 1936, Alfred Tarski set out an axiomatization of the real numbers and their arithmetic, consisting of only  the 8 axioms shown below and a mere four primitive notions:[1] the set of reals denoted R, a binary total order over R, denoted by infix <, a binary operation of addition over R, denoted by infix +, and the constant 1.
